Sahara Star Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 774 reviews

I was so disappointed with this hotel. We decided to splash out our last two nights in Mumbai, and I wish we had gone elsewhere.

it is not a bad hotel, but I would definitely not say it was five star. here's why... The front desk staff were rude. the rest of the staff however were lovely. We booked a city view - we got lagoon. When I talked to reception about it, they said lagoon was a better room. end of conversation. We only had one bathrobe and slippers so had to ask for another - they bought two pair of slippers. The room is pretty dated - the lights are all on a board system and I would have just preferred some lamps! The mini bar was locked! They play the same song pretty much on loop at both the pool bar and the main area, where you can not escape! The TV didn't work, had to be fixed. The pool itself is a 25 min, lovely clean pool - there are, however, 4 sun loungers for a hotel of 200 rooms! not that it was busy, but still. Also no bar there. The breakfast was good! For what you end up spending in this hotel, I would have thought there are much better places for the money. They wanted 1,400 for an airport cab - a taxi outside was 500 rupees.

Show more
bex , United Kingdom
Sea Princess Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 335 reviews

It's a good hotel if you want to stay in that area but lot of negatives for me. There is no free wifi and it's daylight robbery to pay for some Internet.

I felt that everywhere I went and all the staff I interacted with were all hungry for tips. I feel if I had tipped everyone then I would have recieved better service. But it's confusing who to tip as 6 different people got my bags to the room and 3 different people showing us how the tv works and how to use the phone. Also we were stopped and bags checked. They didn't allow us to get food from outside. I was also upset that they didn't hold a deposit amount on the card. They charged my card and gave me a cash refund later. This leads to unnecessary bank charges for me. The room was decently equipped but despite paying higher for a sea facing room, it was only partial sea facing and not worth the upgrade. Room service was cleaning rooms late at night disturbing us and even rang the bell late to ask if all was ok. (tips)

Show more
Dhruv , United Arab Emirates
The Lalit Mumbai
8.3 Excellent
Based on 889 reviews

Travelling back through Mumbai on a combination leisure and business trip the whole experience was flawless.

Had stayed for longer the previous week near to "Gateway to India" Had a flight with Emirates at 4:30 in the morning so stayed for 2 nights close to the airport for convenience but hotel had no airport noise and we were very happy with our room and the hotel facilities. We ate at "Trendz" restaurant on both evenings as the Italian food was exquisite. The best seafood spaghetti that I have ever had even in Italy.

Show more
Jenny , United Kingdom
Hotel Windsor Bay
7.8 Very good
Based on 16 reviews

The Caliph Hotel & Executive Suites
6 Review score
Based on 32 reviews

I spent many hours looking for a good hotel in Mumbai for less than US $100. In past, we have been in some tacky hotels.

But the Metro surprised us with modern, very clean, handsomely decorated hotel rooms. The streets outside is a little rough looking, but once you drive up to the front of the hotel you know you there has been attention paid to creating some beauty. As we are checking in, a young man approaches with a glass of juice for each of us. That was a nice welcome. Because we are paying Agoda rates, I believe they put us on the floor above the lobby, probably saving the rooms with a view for higher paying guests. But the view out either side of the hotel looks out on either greenery or a lake. The furniture is good quality, good sheets, towels a little rough. Nice shower with bathtub. Marble surrounds the sink and tub. One wall needed some fresh paint, but not a big deal. We asked for coffee to be delivered to our room at 6:30 am and it was hot and pronto. The breakfast buffet was Indian with five entries and two kinds of fresh fruit and dried cereal. We had lunch in the same restaurant and the Sag Chicken and Tandoori Chicken was excellent. We will stay again.

Show more
Jeanette , United States
Roseate House New Delhi
8.8 Excellent
Based on 142 reviews

Hotel is ideally located to suite and meet my needs. Rooms are well equipped and very comfortable teeming with nice designs.

Staff are friendly and very attentive trying to meet the smallest needs of the guests staying at the hotel. Food served was very good . . . try the quinoa biryani! if there is something special needing to be made then just ask and likely that chef will attend to it.

Show more
Niraj , Nepal
Grand Chennai by GRT Hotels
8.5 Excellent
Based on 408 reviews

From the outside, the hetel is impressive, and the foyer is grand, with the glass elevator. The reception was cold.

I had a feeling, they were overworked, and underpaid. No smiles, just very brusk. The room was OK, but the bathroom was missing toiletries. The breakfast closes at 10 am. The first morning, we missed it by 5 minutes. There were people still eating, but they wouldn't let us in. Fine, the next day, were were there early, and find out they were letting people through well after 10:00 am. If you want to be hard nosed about your rules, make them uniform. Don't pick and choose. Overall, for the money, I would stay elsewhere. When I pay money, I would at least like to see a smile.

Show more
Ramgopal , United States
Shangri-La's Eros Hotel New Delhi
8.5 Excellent
Based on 378 reviews

I left my wrist watch at the spa's locker yesterday and left to airport and didn't realise it until I passed immigration point.

I called the lost and found and they found my watch, and talked to manager, the immigration doesn't allowed me to reenter india to go back to hotel. The manager immediately arrange someone to deliver it to me, hand over to singapore airlines counter who then pass me the watch at the gate, all done in 45 minutes! I would like to thank the exceptional staffs, service way beyond 5 stars. Please send my thanks to the manager and all the staffs, they have done something extraordinary.

Show more
Mony , Indonesia
The Lalit New Delhi
8.2 Excellent
Based on 965 reviews

Our stay at The Lalit was amazing! The moment our taxi stopped at the entrance to the moment we left, we were treated like family by each member of staff we came into contact with during our 5 day stay.

There was not 1 person without a smile, or hello how are you, can we help.... and the list is endless. The Lalit has won our hearts after staying at many 5 star hotels in Delhi, we have finally decided to call The Lalit our home whenever we travel to Delhi. The location is also excellent right in the centre and therefore close to wherever you wish to get to. The rooms are above standard for this class of hotel and all your needs are catered for. the personal amenities are excellent. In the foyer there is a table whereupon is placed a fresh flower and a card with the Vedic explanation for the day of the week. So as you walk in for your extravagant breakfast you can take a fresh flower the card and WOW your day is off to a flying start full of positivity and good vibes. Well done to the management and staff of The Lalit; travellers ....you do not need to look anywhere else. Cheers.

Show more
Madhukar , Australia
The Park New Delhi Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 679 reviews

We were staying in a luxury room of this hotel and breakfast was included in it ! Regarding room,it was big and having all necessary room ameneties like aircon,hot and cold shower,plazma tv etc and all were in good working condition ! Breakfast was also good and enjoyable ! Plenty of veg-nog veg varieties and if one having little bit late around 10 am then he/she will not required to have lunch in the afternoon ! Since it is 5 star hotel in the capital of India,nothing to worry about and have no complain !

DIPESHKUMAR , India
The Accord Metropolitan Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 1384 reviews

hmmmm, look very huge and glamorous in the photo for the exterior , but actually is much more smaller than the photo shown, the lobby is beautiful, the compliment breakfast is kinda compromise, the indian cuisine dont taste authentic , it seem they reduce the spiciness for tourist, the pongal is terrible, even the small stall across the street serve better pongal then them, for those western/international selection are quite limited, only have hardboil egg, no much non-vege item.

...i had stay in two different room in this hotel during my trip, and i notice some of the room have very advance and fancy equipment, like toilet bowl with integrate automatic washing nozzle , mediahub, usb charger, while some of them got nothing at all

Show more
tat , Malaysia
Lake Pichola Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 500 reviews

Hotel has a fantastic location on the quieter side of Udaipur with a lovely view of main town and its palace, great to sit on the room balcony and watch the day unfold.

The hotel itself has a bit of faded grandeur but where else can you have such a location and view for the price. The decor of the room itself was a bit disappointing in comparison to hotel itself but it did not matter because of the already mentioned balcony (note not all rooms are lake facing). Roof top has a small raised plunge pool, ok for a cool down but not for sitting around, open until 5.00pm, after which the area houses the hotel restaurant, again great views over the lake and city; food was mixed, one of our best meals during our stay in India and also one of the least interesting. Really enjoyed our few days here and would recommend.

Show more
julie , United Kingdom
BrijRama Palace - A Heritage Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 28 reviews

An excellent place to stay in Varanasi. Staff were very good, friendly and professional during our 3 days stay.

The room was comfortable although a bit small, with good WiFi and complementary mini bar. We only encountered 2 problems. It looked like reception forgot to arrange our airport transfer when we left. We were given a second class taxi (not their own hotel car) which was just big enough to squeeze 2 passengers with our luggage but we still paid the full price. Also, reception called during boat transfer to say they'd forgotten to charge us for a river ride we had the day before (a line on the bill still mentioned a boat ride on the 12th) so we had to pay cash. Fortunately we had enough money on us but this could have been a problem later on if we had needed the cash at the airport.

Show more
SERGE , France
The Ashok Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 99 reviews

Location is good. Hotel cleanness is maintained. Staff lazy specially housekeeping staff. Restaurants offer good delicious food with good service but the portion served of same item is different.

Cheaper restaurant serves more quantity and higher price menu serves less quantity I hv experienced in desert order (kulfi). Staff very irresponsible. My personal experience it happened with me on 20.1.17 at 4pm. I was on the way to airport and I recd a call from duty manager saying that when am I going to check out I answered already chkd out, than he saying rudely who is going to pay ur bill for food u hv eaten. As I hv booked the room through Agoda room bill was already cleared before chk in. I answered him already cleared the food bill, instead of checking the system or with cashier he kept on arguing with me. Very bad. People should raise voice and write the review so that it creates a good change to best improvement and management should take action against such staff.

Show more
Diwakar , India
The Lalit Great Eastern Kolkata
8.6 Excellent
Based on 198 reviews

The rooms were comfortable and aesthetically pleasing, with everything that a traveler would care about — solid bed, toiletries and hairdryer, as well as nice, and hot shower.

There was a wide selection of Indian and continental offerings for the breakfast, along with many choices for drinks including the delectable strawberry lassi and water melon juice. Moreover, the staff in the breakfast room were warm, attentive, and responsive. They were eager to introduce us to the Indian foods that had to be prepared fresh like the utapam and dosa. Best of all, this quality was exhibited by most of the other staff in the other areas of the hotel, which included anticipating the needs of the guests. After a tough three-week journey throughout India, it was genuinely wonderful to be at a hotel where the staff strives for outstanding customer service!

Show more
Jerome , France
Alsisar Haveli - A Heritage Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 115 reviews

We loved Alsisar Haveli. The rooms did vary so we asked to see a few different ones and struck gold 4th time lucky - huge room with painted ceiling, stained glass windows, chandeliers, 4 poster bed - simply stunning.

It felt very special and authentic. The breakfast was excellent too - waffles and omelettes cooked to order, along with English breakfast tea (I don't like sweet chai so this was great) and several Indian options which were nice to try. The waiting staff were very friendly and looked extremely smart in their turbans and tunics. Only two very small criticisms (and I am often hard to please)....the tiling round the edge of the pool is discoloured and could do with being replaced and the reception staff were not nearly as friendly and accommodating as the rest. Other than this, I would HIGHLY recommend this beautiful hotel - in our opinion it beats the much more expensive Samode Haveli and also Nirain Niwas Palace which is similarly priced and similar standard, but not as special.

Show more
Laura , United Arab Emirates
The Raintree Hotel - Annasalai
8.6 Excellent
Based on 478 reviews

The hotel and staff were great. Very Polite and nothing to hard for them to do for you. From good security to good food.

The restaurant caters for western as well as Indian tastes. The food was always fresh. Though in room service the food arrived luke warm and also the noise from the night clubs is a bit much these are really the only negatives. My advice is get a room away from the wing which houses the Nightclub. Overall my stay was Fantastic and the amenities and room where beautiful. Loved also a paper being delivered daily. I highly recommend this hotel as it delivers more bang for the dollar and it is well worth it. You won't be disappointed.

Show more
Jeriah , Australia
The Raintree Hotel - St.Mary's Road
8.8 Excellent
Based on 193 reviews

Very nice hotel. I stayed 4 nights although I did have to pay additional for a extension since my flight was late in the evening.

Everything went as expected. I really enjoyed my stay there. The only hiccup was the pick up from the hotel where I could not find the hotel staff although I was looking for someone from the hotel. I was advised later on checkin that they did turn up at the airport to pick me up. The hotel was new and clean and the staff was generally helpful. Its also quite centrally located with good proxity to the airport and the main tourist sites in Chennai.

Show more
Charles , Malaysia
Shangri-La Hotel Bengaluru
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 60 reviews

Was putting up there for Business purposes. Every member of the staff was amazing! Such a class act of courtesy and every one was eager to attend to my needs! The room was spacious and well kept.

Amazing!

Show more
Gideon , Singapore
The Leela Palace New Delhi
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 208 reviews

After three weeks of hard business travel I needed a few days to relax and rest before getting on a long flight home.

At the Leela Palace I was able to fully rejuvenate. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and fully equipped with anything anyone would ever want. The food was unbelievable. I have to maintain a Gluten Free diet and the menu had fully designated gluten free items...I was delighted. The spa is excellent! If I were to make a complaint I would say I was slightly over attended. I have never been asked so often if I am comfortable, or if there was anything I needed or if there was anything that could be made better. If you want to avoid this all you have to do is hit the "do not disturb" button and a world of quiet, rest and relaxation awaits you.

Show more
Aimee , United States
The Residency Towers
8.3 Excellent
Based on 381 reviews

One of the best experience. We booked the hotel in advance about more than a month ago from Singapore as we plan this trip, but we did not request for Airport pickup initially.

Only when we were in Trichi we decided that we need this service to fetch us from the Airport to the Hotel. Though the request was made in less than 24 hrs notice but RT made the arrangement to pick us up from the Chennai airport. Then as we arrived at RT, the receptionist is very helpful and honest. The manager at the restaurant where we had our breakfast is very polite. He explained about the foods available and on the 2nd day we were almost late and missed the breakfast but he was so understanding and let us have our complete breakfast. The distance to most of the shopping sites and attractions were very convenient, some even less than 15 mins walking distance. I love to come back to RT whenever I visit Chennai

Show more
Raja , Singapore
Fraser Suites New Delhi
7.5 Very good
Based on 211 reviews

The Hotel staff was not prompt. Polite, but lacked in upkeeping the Hotel. Hotel had all the amenities we were looking for, but some of them were not functioning.

YOu had to ask for everything, eg. plates, spoons, cups etc. in the kitchen and it would take an hour before it got to you. Rooms were not ready for check in, even though we were past check in time. They lied to us, that rooms would be on one floor, when 2, 2-bedroom suites were not on the same floor. They had one above the other on each floor. The bathroom showers were not working in both suites when we checked in. Soap etc. were not added the next day. You had to ask for everything. Floors of the room were not mopped, really dusty to walk on without shoes. Breakfast was good. Again, service was slow. Did not seem like the Hotel was busy at all, even then they could not keep up with the requests.

Show more
Deepti , United States
Katriya Hotel & Towers
6.2 Good
Based on 518 reviews

except for courteous trainees thte hotel was pathetic.I had booked a luxury suite at Katriya and when I reached the hotel they took 45 min.

To check and confirm from server the booking. After filling form they wanted 30 min to get the room prepared. While checking in they said for a day there would be no hot water as boiler he broken down it will take a day to repair. But never got hot water for both the days of stay. we're being given water in buckets like some guest house after coaxing the staff. When I checked into the room which they had just cleaned . I was shocked to see a huge dead Rat in the bedroom of the suite. I never had such an experience ever. Went to have breakfast and the very first morning almost all the items had got over and people were fighting over the left over. On the second day when we went for break fast the restaurant it was closed and they directed us to a banquet in the basement. The place looked like a shelter for flood victims and around 100 people were fighting for plates and cups . Hardly any food was left and the hotel staff were getting irritated and not interested in providing even a glass of water. It was a horrible experience from such a hotel and none of the senior staff were interested in addressing the issue. Except few trainees who were sent to apologise to customers while leaving. Horrible experience .. to be forgotton. Not expected from a hotel recommended by a well known travel site

Show more
Shivkumar , India
Meluha The Fern
8.6 Excellent
Based on 72 reviews

Hotel authority sell our room to others & tried to damp in their other cheiper hotel. After 2 hours conversation.

They have shifted us other hotel. We were not happy with the hotel Next day we came back after 21/2 hours Conversation their area GM. Accepted our. Request & accommodate us in the hotel for next two days. This is a embarrassing situation for us . We aspecting your action regarding this.

Show more
Zubayer , Bangladesh
Hotel Ramada-Amritsar
8.3 Excellent
Based on 198 reviews

Stayed here for 4 nights. Breakfast is good, rooms are large and has a lot of tv channels and a fridge.

Shower is good. Some rooms smell of smoke a bit but just get them to change it. The staff do some things well and some things in an odd way that doesn't suit guests. Like booking you a taxi through mega cab then cancelling it because they want you to use their taxi service to the airport because it's 3 times the price. So you have to call mega cab yourself. Call mega cab it's only 400 rupees. I recommend staying in Amritsar for 2 nights. We were struggling to find things to do on the 4th day. Go to golden temple, a lumbar at either the Hindu or golden temple, the wags border is an awesome spectacle and the dhabas have some great food. You can get beer at a 'wine shop' about a km from the ramada. Be warned the beer is crap but does the job if you need one. Foreigners pay max price of 150 rupees for a large strong beer.

Show more
Paul , Australia
BKR Grand Hotel
6.5 Good
Based on 475 reviews

Not worth the price. Rooms are not clean on the day of arrival. Stains everywhere. Safe Locker is locked and they can't reset it.

Doesn't accommodate to change room. Wifi is literally useless. The room card software is awful where we had to to renew it everyday after 12pm. Room heater is useless. Water flood the toilet and no proper drain. Staff are not friendly and not helpful. Only met 2 in the entire stay of 7 days who smiled and helped, even that for a tips. Only plus point is the location where close to shopping areas but for this price it's better to stay somewhere else and pay 30rupees to auto to travel. Will never stay again.

Show more
Shashidharan , Malaysia
The Orchid Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 354 reviews

kushalchand , India
The Zuri White Sands, Goa Resort & Casino
8 Very good
Based on 134 reviews

We enjoyed staying at Zuri in February 2013. Zuri is located in southern Goa -- which is about a 45 min taxi ride from the airport.

The location is fairly remote, so while quiet, entertainment options outside the resort are extremely limited. There are many activities available at the resort and beach (most cost extra) for all age ranges. The resort is somewhat older, but very well maintained and clean. The garden grounds and swimming pool are both expansive and picturesque. The large gardens separate the hotel from the beach, so plan on about a 10 minute walk before you reach the ocean. There is private beach area (sand, really) with a great ocean view on the hotel grounds, but it is physically separated from the actual beach & water. The beach itself was quiet and not at all crowded. The food at Zuri was a highlight -- robust breakfast buffet, and occasional special evening barbeques with various meat options and live preparation + entertainment. Food quality is generally decent, but spices are toned way down for the significant foreigner crowd (many Russian). Food value is average -- drink and meal prices definitely capitalize on the captive audience of a remote location. In all, the resort is nice for a family vacation at a western standard, but falls short of 5-star luxury.

We decided to splash out our last two nights in Mumbai, and I wish we had gone elsewhere. it is not a bad hotel, but I would definitely not say it was five star. here's why... The front desk staff were rude. the rest of the staff however were lovely. We booked a city view - we got lagoon. As we are checking in, a young man approaches with a glass of juice for each of us. That was a nice welcome. The beach next to the hotel is no big deal, and the food is not good, and didn't seem fresh. The resort is far away from everything, and they charge a preposterous amount for transfers (for instance, they wanted to charge us INR 500 (US$ 10) for a 3 km ride to the next town. MOST IMPORTANTLY, there's absolutely no alternative transportation (unless you've rented a scooter), as they forbid taxis and tuk-tuks from approaching the resort. Once we got inside, we felt trapped there and extorted. Show more Rui , Portugal Le Pondy Beach and Lake Resort 7.8 Very good Based on 96 reviews We had stayed for 2 nites during first week of September. We had taken 3 lake facing rooms. On requesting through email for 2 groundfloor and 1 upper floor room, the hotel allocated the same. We had booked thro Agoda and got a good deal with 1 nite complementary stay. Only problem was that we had to pay for the 2nd day bkft eventhough it was reflecting as complementary bkft on agoda's website. Infact, we paid a higher room rate on Agoda just because it stated that breakfast was included. Agoda itself had 2 room rates for the 1 nite complementary stay offer for lake view room. We chose the higher one as it specifically mentioned 'breakfast included'. At the time of check-in the hotel reception informed us that according to their policy, only the 1 nite stay is complementary not the bkft. We tried calling Agoda both on the day of check-in and check-out. There was no response. They only have an overseas contact number and noone was picking up the call. So, this incident made us regret booking thro Agoda. The resort is in a great location with the lake on one side and the beach on the other. It is so nice to get up and look out at the lake and boats plying on it. A walk on the beach was highly rejuvenating. Early morning walks at beach highly recommended. We even managed to see some dolphins frolicking in the sea. For stay in Pondy, it is Le Pondy that should come to mind. Great place. Show more Mohammed , India Novotel Goa Resort & Spa - An AccorHotels Brand 7.8 Very good Based on 24 reviews Not a very pleasant stay. We had 2 rooms and entered to realise that in both the rooms, there was a problem with the air conditioning. We asked the staff to change the rooms and they took around 5 hrs to get back to us!. Not expected from a 5 star brand like Novotel!. And almost 800m from the beach and takes the feel away of staying in a beach resort in Goa. Would give it a miss for some luxury 5 star resort with a private beach in south Goa, the next time that I am in Goa. Show more Amitabha , India Wild Orchid Resort - Havelock Island 7.1 Very good Based on 14 reviews Chandys Windy Woods Resort 9 Excellent Based on 35 reviews We loved our stay at the hotel. The highlight are the staff who are extremely helpful in every possible way. They arranged bespoke tours for us and had good cultural events in the evening. As we are vegetarians, we often find the breakfast and lunch options minimal in most hotels, but certainly not this as we were spoilt for choice. The staff, such as Mr Chinchu were very helpful in taking us to off beaten tracks and taking photos, recommending good restaurants, etc. All in all, a very good holiday at this hotel and in Munnar and surroundings. There are a few things to improve as with most things in life - the recreation room needs a modernization, cycles for children needed, balconies need a bit more protection for families, etc; but none of these are really did affect the holiday much. Show more Ravishankar , Qatar Poovar Island Resort 8.2 Excellent Based on 58 reviews For this price I get in Germany 5-star hotel, which is shines with cleanliness. The room in the floating house was very clean, but bath room has rust and salt on water-taps. That is ok in 2-star hotel for 30€ per day, but not for that price. Moreover the electric facilities were broken, so I had every 2 minutes awful noise during the night. I could not sleep! Than they were repairing it in the night and during the day, so I was not always able to be in house. They could move me into other house! However stuff was very helpful and polite, fulfilling every wish. Show more Andriy , Germany The Baga Marina Beach Resort & Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 109 reviews i hesitated between this hotel to another one. i'm glade i chose this one. normally i don't write reviews, since i don't belive a good review when i see one, but i really had a good time in this hotel. nice hotel, everything is quiet, nice and clean. the pool was clean and they had nice bar next to the pool. the room was great - very clean and nice. everything was in walking distance. all the recommended restaurants and bars that i read about on the internet, was really 5 to 13min walk. there were plenty of things to do, but for me it was only relexation after business trip. Show more Eran , Israel Lemon Tree Amarante Beach Resort 8.3 Excellent Based on 94 reviews We went to this place on a weekday for a short stay of three days only. We went in March which is generally suppose to be 'non peak season' in Goa. Surprised to find all rooms booked in this place. It had domestic as well as international tourists occupying rooms. They have a cafe and a restaurant in their property and a big size pool with spaces for kids, grown ups and in pool bar service. They have pool side beds with service which I though was pretty cool as you may spend a lot of time in the hotel as they offer most comforts. There is a supermarket just 2mins away which comes very handy at times. The staff is cordial and the overall service is very pleasant and responsive. I think this place is nice to go back to if you are interested in short stays but frequent visits. Looking forward to being in this place in rains. Show more Hemant , India Sea Mist Beach Resort 7.9 Very good Based on 152 reviews overall the only really negative thing i could say was the room we were using [ a7] the power kept tripping out all the time we mentioned this to the management on several occasions with answers ranging from a shrug of the shoulders to 1 who actually explained the power grid of the hotel and why the electricity sometimes trips out in india,overall a good hotel that would only be fair if it was not for the excellent [ and undervalued ] staff. judith , United Kingdom Montego Bay Beach Village 8.2 Excellent Based on 34 reviews The location is awesome. Resort is well maintained, greenery everywhere. It almost feels like being in a clean and neat isolated coastal village. The rooms are comfortable, depending on the cottage you get. Most cottages have large king size bed that occupies most of the room making it inconvenient to roam around. Fortunately, we got a cottage with a relatively smaller double bed. The bathrooms are clean but could be slightly bigger, not enough space for showers. This is about cottages. We did not have a chance to look at the tents but I reckon the condition may not be very different. Being strictly vegetarian, we had quite a bit of a problem with the food situation. The vegetarian menu is extremely limited and the taste isn't great. They can improve on that. The beach is one of the cleanest I know, plenty water-sport opportunities. Sunset from the beach is a must experience thing. Overall, the place is highly recommended for those who seek a calm and peaceful homely holiday. Not meant for people who prefer crowds and parties. Show more Prajakt , India Ganpati Guest House 8.3 Excellent Based on 517 reviews This hotel is OK if you really want to stay right on the riverside. The biggest problem with that is that it is really difficult to get to. The area is closed to vehicles, so the closest you can get with an Autotaxi is about 1.5 Km. You can then hire a bicycle rickshaw to get another 1/2 Km, but after that you have to go on foot. At that point you need to hire a guide (they will swarm you). Without hiring a guide, you will NOT find it. The hotel supposedly will send someone out to lead you in, but that didn't work for me, I called them, told them I had a reservation and had just arrived at the train station. I asked if 1.5 km was really as close as I could get with a taxi and they said yes and hung up. Didn't mention anything about sending a guide out until I finally managed to get to the hotel. All in all, it's quire an ordeal to get to the hotel. Show more Steven , United States Winds Desert Camp 8.6 Excellent Based on 36 reviews Considering it was our first visit to Jaisalmer, I didn't know what to expect. Initially while making the booking, I was a bit skeptical because the place seemed a little expensive. But this place surprised me. I think it was completely worth it. The tents were clean and nice and on reaching they welcomed us with music and welcome drinks. Camel safari was included in the package. And when we got back from the camel safari, they had the entire night programme planned with folk singers and dancers. The food served was typically Rajasthani and very tasty. Way better than our expectations. I am extremely satisfied with this place and would definitely visit again. :) Show more sneha , India Damodra Desert Luxury Camp Tents 9.1 Exceptional Based on 37 reviews We had wonderful experiences over there with the great hospitality, well kept tent with peaceful atmosphere. The only unworthy matter was time. Thier check in time strictly 1500hrs even though we wanted to go around 1200noon,was impossible. Promised at 1400hrs for a pickup but the driver didn't approached us till 1440hrs. On the way stop to get mineral water, brought us to visit abundant village. We reached the camp around 1630hrs. Within 30 minutes jeep picked us up for a camel ride about 15- 20 minutes, reached desert at 1800hrs. We only able to enjoy the sunset about 5 minutes. Had a good time with sand boat. Getting dark, back to camp. Everything happened so fast. Had a wonderful evening with music, dance and nice food. Free and easy at night... and next day morning with good breakfast . Check out by 1100hrs. On the way back the driver should show us mud houses but he said he forgot about it. Perfect environment with prefect condition but need more time to enjoyed it. Show more Murugan , Malaysia Mateus Boutique Hotel 8.8 Excellent Based on 11 reviews Jaiwana Haveli 8.5 Excellent Based on 275 reviews My wife and I were delighted to have such a wonderful experience at the Jaiwana Havelli after a somewhat nightmarish experience at Raas Leela Luxury Camp the night before. Jaiwana was half the price and superior service with a staff that genuinely cares about your well being. The room quality was good and it was very clean. Free and fast wifi was available.. and they gave us the password without promoting when we checked in and the fellow who checked us patiently provided answers to a number of questions... even finding a hair dryer for my wife to borrow. They way a terrific roof deck with a great view of the Lake and the surrounding ultra high end well-lit hotels resorts around it. The food is very good and certainly exceeded my expectations for the rooftop restaurant at a non-5 star hotel. Since we were leaving early the next day, I mentioned that we would be leaving very early and needed to resolve all issues that evening which we did.. . he then took the initiative to prepare a free bagged breakfast so we had something to eat since we were missing our included breakfast. If you are looking for a very clean and reasonably priced hotel with all the basic western amenities (wi-fi, a/c, heat, private bathroom, quiet room), a delightful staff and a great restaurant I strongly recommend this place! Show more Nolan , United States Pleasant Inn 7.8 Very good Based on 109 reviews It was a very nice clean spacious room, everything seemed new and professional. I got the idea they had been running hotels successfully for quite some time. Breakfast is delivered to your room around 8, which makes an (early) wake up call, it's ok quality, and seems like an aeroplane/retirement home meal in it's little plastic tray :) Wifi works only in the lobby. The place had some kind of dining facility but I did not get the impression they were open, but enough restaurants and shops nearby. Show more Zane , United Kingdom Casa Baga 6.8 Good Based on 11 reviews Ahuja Residency 7.6 Very good Based on 29 reviews It's a simple small hotel that would only be good for a night's rest. Breakfast buffet doesn't have much option for tourists. Front desk staffs do not have proper turn over of duties after every shift, thus I didn't receive the package I was expecting because they returned it to the courier saying there wasn't anyone with that name, amidst informing them that I was expecting a package. The worst part is the door of the room can't be locked properly we had to shove our heavy luggages against the door to make sure it's closed. Show more Maria , Philippines Sea Horse Cottages 7.8 Very good Based on 61 reviews Firstly, the service they provide is wonderful. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. For instance, we were 5 of us and wanted to go to cabana, the hotel arranged for a taxi to drop us and later pick up at ANY TIME in the night. Bikes and stuffs like that were arranged instantly by the hotel. Food is great too. The cottages were quite good as well. The only major drawback is that they don't take credit/debit cards. But pretty much the whole of goa doesn't take cards. So that was a problem everywhere. Had to carry cash which was annoying. Otherwise, it's a great place to stay and I would definitely stay there the next time I go to goa. Wonderful experience! Show more Kirk , Australia Hotel The Tiger 8.3 Excellent Based on 63 reviews This hotel is situated just a few feet from the lake-side with fabulous views from the terrace of the whole lake. It is also in a small alleyway, so does not get too much traffic noise ( if you have problem finding it, tell the driver it is close tp Cafe Namaste and opposite Cafe Edeilwise). The hotel is well kept and maintained and the rooms, sheets and stairs sparkling clean. The hotel manage Pritam and restaurant manager AnerudhIt are just fantastic and nothing is too much of a problem. Itis also convenient walk to the City Palace. @ 1/2 hours to see the fabulous Jain temples at Ranakpur. The best restaurant for b/fast and dinner is Cafe Namaste, just across the road, who have roof top restaurant for dinner ( tea Rs 30, good muffins and cakes Rs 40, fried eggs on toast RS70) and good tandoori chicken\Rs 400" Spent Christmas and New Year there. Great view of the New Years eve fireworks from rooftop terrace. The German owner Gunther was there too and could have done something special for the few hotel guests that were up there watching the fireworks as a few snack and soft drinks would have been a good gesture and costs just a few rupees in India. Show more Gilroy , United Kingdom Ahuja Residency Golf Links 8.7 Excellent Based on 12 reviews Prince Desert Camp Resort 8.2 Excellent Based on 17 reviews The location of the camp is good, it near sand dunes so ideal for people who wish to stay in the midst of nature, however far from main road where most of the camps are located. But it is very safe and peaceful. The tents are clean and comfortable and all basic facilities are available. The service is excellent and staff is very attentive to the needs of the guests. They are very helpful and proactively volunteer for help if they sense that the guests are looking for something. Show more Swapnil , India Wild Elephant Eco-Friendly Resort 4.9 Review score Based on 9 reviews KEVINS 9.1 Exceptional Based on 6 reviews Sita Guest House 6.5 Good Based on 179 reviews One must take into account the City of Varanasis as a whole when making a review. It is a very old city with mainly crumbling buildings, narrow laneways and lots of poverty. Our hotel was in a perfect location. Rooms are small but have all one really needs, without beig lavish. Pay a little extra and take a room with balcony overlooking the river and not stop movement. Very good food in the rooftop restaurant with pleasant service,although slow. But hat is all over India. Lovely staff, particularly Amid. He will go out of his way to make sure you see everything in Varanasis. He will also help with other travel plans and booking throughout India.He is more than just the perfect guid.Will be your friend. Show more Graeme , Australia Metropolis Tourist Home 8.1 Excellent Based on 76 reviews Can be seen that era, traditional hotel downstairs is quite lively the street shopping very lively five minutes' walk from the subway is our line in India, the most modern interior decoration, very clean, good rooftop restaurant environment, tastes not bad. Is street noisier small and expensive, the price, of course, synthetic RMB think it is acceptable. The service is pretty good, you need to tip. The proposed itinerary is the last day you can live here, in front of the side street can stroll, make up to buy some gifts. 10:00 can wander at night is also good, relatively safe. Show more Li , China Capithans Bungalow 7.8 Very good Based on 3 reviews Fort House 8.8 Excellent Based on 45 reviews The place is situated on the waterfront which makes for very romantic atmosphere. It's a busy hotel but always feels serene because of its location. It had money exchanging services on site. The garden is very calming and being by the water feels like a luxury. Rooms are great value, and simply furnished but comfortable and no complaints. AC and Fan. I wouldn't hesitate to book here again. Great location for tourists visit to Fort Kochi in the middle of everything for biennale. Food is fantastic quality and good prices. Service we appreciated but because it's busy waterfront restaurant, and cooked fresh can be little slow. But we had no major issues. Love love this hotel. Massive recommendedactions. Show more Raisa , United Kingdom Shaolin Guest House 8.8 Excellent Based on 54 reviews This is a basic home stay with all basic amenities. You wont get anything luxurious over here except the hospitality. I can bet you will hardly get any such host ever in your entire life. They are such a nice people. You will get all possible kind of help that are within the reach of Mr. Phuntsug and his wife. The helper boy Dharmendra will be ready for your service at any time.The room's size are okay and are neat in terms of cleanliness. Not all rooms have attached toilet but few are there. You wont get plenty of varieties in food but they are all fresh , collected form the adjacent garden of the guest house. One great thing is. you can have any number of green teas you want. The distance from city center could be a possible worry unless you are a pure lover of nature and peace. The guest house is blessed with it's beautiful location which gives it an added advantage to offer such pacific environment. Show more Arijit , India Maa Ashapura Resort 9.1 Exceptional Based on 3 reviews Bissau Palace 7.2 Very good Based on 75 reviews The best thing about this place is the ancient antique feel, like stepping back in time. The drawback of that is ancient not very good bathroom and a fountain in the middle of our room which my husband kept tripping over! Bed linen and towels a bit grey and old but the tv worked and there was free wifi. Breakfast was ok and the staff were actually really nice. There's a small pool which was fine but not much garden. Be warned, don't walk out at night and it's quite a poor area so not ideal for walking around on your own. But it's very close to the old Pink City (actually terracotta coloured!) and the palaces etc. Show more Frances , United Kingdom Evergreen Suites Defence Colony 7.9 Very good Based on 21 reviews Secret Garden Agonda 8.9 Excellent Based on 37 reviews I think that cocohuts are overpriced. $1200 per month – that's too much for Agonda. I spent 8 days and nobody ever cleaned my house during this time. I experienced constant issues with wi-fi. Bu the way, you should be ready that there are blackouts few times per day, every day in Agonda and Goa in general. I know that booked cocohut with seaview. However I was let into another house (with the view of another house – very "romantic"). I was extremely disappointed and started to argue. The owner replied that if I don't like something I can leave. Such a nice welcome! I didn't stop to defend my right and was relocated to a better house next day but my impressions were ruined anyways. I cannot call personnel and the owners friendly. They seem to be nice but actually they don't care. It can be a good option if you don't mind wi-fi issues and going to stay for a short period of time. Sunset is really beautiful. Show more Valeriia , Ukraine Woodberry Residency 8 Very good Based on 48 reviews Nice location, cordial staff, good food! It is not a 3 start facility. We were 4 and had 2 rooms with shared toilet. Similar to service apartment, less kitchen. Stayed for 2 nights. We reached late at about 9PM. Though usual check out time is 11AM they allowed us to say till 1.30PM. Thanks to the staff. On the negative side the bed sheets, pillow covers and blankets look old and no so clean. I was told that they have ordered for new blankets and bed covers which are expected anytime soon. The wardrobe look OK from outside but inside it looks old. It may need a coat of varnish or polish. You have to order for food 40 minutes in advance but it was hot and tasty at all 5 times we had it from there. Show more Sanjeev , India Sunvalley Homestay Coonoor 9 Excellent Based on 38 reviews The hotel was well signposted but its location was well off the main roads. Once found, it was very peaceful with lovely views. Sunvalley offered no additional facilities other than the basic board and food. If you are prepared to accept South Indian cuisine then you will be well catered for. However, if you request anything different, in our case simple English fare, then you will be disappointed. The staff were very pleasant and most helpful. Show more John , India Fiesta Beach Resort 9.6 Exceptional Based on 1 reviews Imperial Apartments 7.5 Very good Based on 23 reviews I regret to choose this hotel, first the place very unexpected its deep inside, and second they not allow us to change the room floor level. . With unaccepted reason.. We have right to change level floor room as we feel comfort why they forbidd us..and also we need ask them to open our room because no door card work... So its like we dont have privacy at all when we want to open the door need them to open up...I regret really its not worthed of money.. The hotel view was reallyy badd... But so far food good but expensive ... I wish you all think twice and choose the more good hotel or apartment with same price but good service Show more elisia , Indonesia The Shelter Hotel - Port Blair 7.8 Very good Based on 48 reviews More like homestay than hotel. But clean not so big honeymoon suits with excellent view. Staffs are very helpful. Simple home cooked tasty breakfast & dinner. Lunches if required they will take the order & deliver from nearby restaurant. They also help in booking transportation at very reasonable cost. But no need to book your car during arrival as it can be booked from airport on arrival & lot cheaper. TV has several cable channels. AC works properly. But big drawback for elders, no lift & hotel is on 2nd floor. Show more Susmita , India Hotel Chaman Palace 6.2 Good Based on 11 reviews A nice hotel. Convenient location in the heart of Shimla (and close to the palace and the temple of Hanuman). The staff is very polite. There is hot water. Clean. Fish and a beautiful garden. Wi-fi works great. Thank you very much. Be careful! Next to the hotel travel agency Great Himalayan Travels works there fraudster Sachin. Go to the hotel this agency has nothing to do, just close located. Show more Aleksandra , Russia Grand Residency Hotel & Serviced Apartments 7.8 Very good Based on 33 reviews My husband and I recently stayed here as we were in Mumbai for a friend's wedding. We originally booked a studio apartment but it wasn't available the first night we checked in so they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom apartment for the next few nights. The apartment was wonderful and we felt right at home there. The staff was helpful with our needs and we were always greeted by the doorman with smiles. There are lots of places to shop/eat/drink around the hotel with a little exploring and we couldn't think of any other place to return to after a full day of festivities.
